type.name: APT
type.description: An advanced persistent threat group, typically well-resourced and highly skilled.

type.name: Private company
type.description: A privately owned business entity, often a target or participant in cyber activities.

type.name: Cyber criminal
type.description: An individual or group engaging in illegal activities for financial gain.

type.name: Generic
type.description: A generic or unspecified actor type.

type.name: Hacktivist
type.description: An individual or group using hacking to promote political or social agendas.

type.name: Individual
type.description: A single person involved in threat activity or as a target.

type.name: Insider threat
type.description: An individual within an organization posing a security risk.

type.name: Nation-state actor
type.description: A government-sponsored group conducting cyber operations.

type.name: NGO
type.description: A non-governmental organization.

type.name: Public institution
type.description: A government or public sector organization.

type.name: Threat actor
type.description: An individual or group responsible for malicious cyber activities.

type.name: Android backup image
type.description: A backup image created from an Android device.

type.name: Android sample
type.description: A sample file specific to the Android platform.

type.name: Archive
type.description: A compressed file or collection of files, such as ZIP or TAR.

type.name: Audio
type.description: A file containing audio content, such as MP3, WAV, or AAC.

type.name: Backup image
type.description: A file containing a backup copy of data or a system image.

type.name: Binary file
type.description: A file containing binary data, not intended to be read as text.

type.name: Cryptographic activity trace
type.description: A file logging cryptographic operations or key usage.

type.name: Document
type.description: A generic document file, such as PDF, DOCX, or ODT.

type.name: Email file
type.description: A file containing email messages, such as EML or MSG format.

type.name: Forensic dump
type.description: A file containing a forensic image or memory dump.

type.name: Generic
type.description: A file that does not fit into any of other predefined categories.

type.name: HAR file
type.description: A file containing HTTP Archive (HAR) data for web traffic analysis.

type.name: Image
type.description: A file containing a still image, such as JPG, PNG, or GIF.

type.name: iOS backup image
type.description: A backup image created from an iOS device.

type.name: iOS sample
type.description: A sample file specific to the iOS platform.

type.name: JSON file
type.description: A file in JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) format.

type.name: PCAP file
type.description: A file capturing network traffic, typically in PCAP format.

type.name: Report
type.description: A file containing an analytical or investigative report.

type.name: Sample
type.description: A generic sample file, often used for malware or suspicious files.

type.name: Social media post
type.description: A file or record representing a post from a social media platform.

type.name: Socket activity trace
type.description: A file recording socket or network connection activity.

type.name: SSL keylog file
type.description: A file containing SSL/TLS session keys for decrypting network traffic.

type.name: Text file
type.description: A plain text file, such as TXT or LOG.

type.name: Video
type.description: A file containing video content, such as MP4, AVI, or MOV.

type.name: Web page
type.description: A file containing web page content, such as HTML or XHTML.

type.name: Piece of code
type.description: A snippet or segment of source code from any programming language.

type.name: Generic
type.description: A general or unspecified data fragment type that does not fit other categories.

type.name: Pattern
type.description: A recognizable sequence or structure, such as a regular expression or YARA rule.

type.name: Raw payload
type.description: A block of raw binary or encoded data.

type.name: Piece of text
type.description: A fragment of unstructured or plain text.

type.name: Generic
type.description: A general or unspecified detection rule type that does not fit other categories.

type.name: Suricata rule
type.description: A rule for the Suricata engine to detect network threats and suspicious traffic.

type.name: Yara rule
type.description: A rule used to identify and classify malware or files based on patterns.

type.name: Desktop
type.description: A personal computer intended for regular use at a single location.

type.name: Generic
type.description: A general or unspecified device type that does not fit other categories.

type.name: Internet of Things
type.description: A device connected to the internet, often embedded and used for specific functions (e.g., smart home devices).

type.name: Laptop
type.description: A portable personal computer designed for mobile use.

type.name: Mobile device
type.description: A handheld device such as a smartphone or tablet.

type.name: Router
type.description: A network device that forwards data packets between computer networks.

type.name: Server
type.description: A computer or system that provides resources, data, or services to other computers over a network.

type.name: Alert
type.description: A notification or warning about a detected security event or anomaly.

type.name: Attack
type.description: An event indicating a deliberate attempt to breach, disrupt, or damage a system or network.

type.name: AntiVirus detection
type.description: An event where antivirus software detects malicious or suspicious activity.

type.name: Communication
type.description: An event involving the exchange of information between entities, such as emails or messages.

type.name: Compromise
type.description: An event indicating that a system, account, or data has been breached or compromised.

type.name: Generic
type.description: An event that does not fit into any of the predefined categories.

type.name: Hit
type.description: An event indicating a match or detection by a rule, signature, or indicator.

type.name: Infection
type.description: An event where a system or device is infected by malware or a similar threat.

type.name: Passive DNS
type.description: An event recording historical DNS resolution data observed passively.

type.name: Resolution
type.description: An event where a domain or hostname is resolved to an IP address.

type.name: Targeted Attack
type.description: An event representing a focused and intentional attack against a specific entity or asset.

type.name: Autonomous system number
type.description: A unique number assigned to a group of IP networks operated by one or more network operators.

type.name: CIDR
type.description: A Classless Inter-Domain Routing block, representing a range of IP addresses.

type.name: Community id
type.description: A hash value used to uniquely identify network flows across tools.

type.name: CVE
type.description: A Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures identifier for publicly known security flaws.

type.name: Dexofuzzy hash
type.description: A fuzzy hash value used to compare Android DEX files for similarity.

type.name: DNS record
type.description: A record containing information about a domain name in the DNS system.

type.name: Domain name
type.description: A human-readable address used to identify resources on the internet.

type.name: Domain registrant
type.description: The individual or organization that owns or controls a domain name.

type.name: Domain registrar
type.description: The organization or entity responsible for registering domain names.

type.name: Email address
type.description: An address used to send and receive electronic mail.

type.name: Generic
type.description: A general or unspecified observable type that does not fit other categories.

type.name: Hostname
type.description: A label assigned to a device on a network, used to identify it in various forms.

type.name: Import hash
type.description: A hash of the import table of a PE file, used to identify similar binaries.

type.name: IPv4
type.description: An IPv4 address, a 32-bit numeric address used for identifying devices on a network.

type.name: IPv6
type.description: An IPv6 address, a 128-bit alphanumeric address for identifying devices on a network.

type.name: Location
type.description: A physical or geographical place, specified by coordinates or address.

type.name: MAC address
type.description: A unique hardware identifier assigned to a network interface card (NIC).

type.name: MD5
type.description: A 128-bit hash value, commonly used to verify file integrity.

type.name: Mutex
type.description: A mutual exclusion object used for process synchronization.

type.name: Namespace
type.description: A container that holds a set of identifiers, such as classes or functions, to avoid naming conflicts.

type.name: Os query
type.description: A query or result from an operating system instrumentation framework.

type.name: File path
type.description: A string specifying the location of a file or directory in a filesystem.

type.name: PE hash
type.description: A hash value calculated from the structure of a Portable Executable (PE) file.

type.name: Phone number
type.description: A numeric identifier used to reach a telephone endpoint.

type.name: Process name
type.description: The name of a running process on a computer system.

type.name: Running service
type.description: A network or system service that is currently active or listening.

type.name: SHA1
type.description: A 160-bit hash value, used for data integrity and file identification.

type.name: SHA256
type.description: A 256-bit hash value, widely used for file and data integrity verification.

type.name: Social account identifier
type.description: A unique identifier for a user account on a social media platform.

type.name: SSL certificate fingerprint
type.description: A hash value uniquely identifying an SSL/TLS certificate.

type.name: URI
type.description: A Uniform Resource Identifier, a string used to identify a resource.

type.name: URL
type.description: A Uniform Resource Locator, specifying the address of a resource on the internet.

type.name: Adware
type.description: Software that automatically displays or downloads advertising material, often unwanted.

type.name: APT
type.description: Advanced Persistent Threat; a prolonged and targeted cyberattack by a well-resourced adversary.

type.name: Backdoor
type.description: Malware that allows unauthorized remote access to a compromised system.

type.name: Botnet
type.description: A network of compromised computers controlled by an attacker to perform coordinated tasks.

type.name: Browser Hijacker
type.description: Malware that alters browser settings, redirects traffic, or injects unwanted ads.

type.name: Cryptojacking
type.description: Unauthorized use of a device to mine cryptocurrency.

type.name: Cyber Attack
type.description: An attempt by hackers to damage, disrupt, or gain unauthorized access to computer systems, networks, or devices.

type.name: Cybercrime
type.description: Criminal activities carried out using computers or the internet, including fraud, theft, and unauthorized access.

type.name: Doxxing
type.description: The act of publicly revealing private or identifying information about an individual without their consent.

type.name: Dropper
type.description: A type of malware designed to deliver and install other malicious software.

type.name: Exploit Kit
type.description: A toolkit used to exploit vulnerabilities in software to deliver malware.

type.name: Generic
type.description: A general or unspecified threat type that does not fit other categories.

type.name: Harassment
type.description: Unwanted behavior intended to intimidate, threaten, or disturb an individual, often through digital means.

type.name: Information Stealer
type.description: Malware designed to steal sensitive information such as credentials or financial data.

type.name: Loader
type.description: Malware that loads and executes other malicious payloads on a system.

type.name: Malvertising
type.description: The use of online advertising to spread malware.

type.name: Malware
type.description: A general term for any software intentionally designed to cause damage or unauthorized actions.

type.name: Mobile Malware
type.description: A malware specifically targeting mobile devices to steal data or perform malicious actions.

type.name: Phishing
type.description: A technique to trick users into revealing sensitive information, often via fake emails or websites.

type.name: Physical Attack
type.description: A threat involving physical actions intended to harm or compromise assets, infrastructure, or individuals.

type.name: Ransomware
type.description: Malware that encrypts data and demands payment for decryption.

type.name: Remote Access Trojan (RAT)
type.description: Malware that provides remote control over an infected system.

type.name: Rootkit
type.description: Malware designed to hide its presence and provide privileged access to a system.

type.name: Spam
type.description: Unsolicited or bulk messages, often used to deliver malware or phishing attempts.

type.name: Spyware
type.description: Malware that secretly gathers user information without consent.

type.name: Stalkerware
type.description: Software used to secretly monitor and track user activity, often for surveillance.

type.name: Trojan
type.description: Malware disguised as legitimate software to trick users into installing it.
